Since Bank Holidays are a popular choice for caravanning Cambridge, we would recommend you to book early to secure your pitch. Easter weekend, May Bank Holiday, Spring Bank Holiday and Summer Bank holiday are the dates you should mark and plan your trip accordingly. Among many places in Cambridge, camping spots around river Ouse that flows for 60 miles towards Goole and river Humber are favourite among nature lovers.Travellers often search for campsites Cambridgeshire when they are passing through St Ives and Houghton. Either they look for a short break for some quick bites or for an overnight stay. Many campsites have perfect pitch ready for such caravanning Cambridge groups. The beautiful pub and restaurant, large play area for children, warm and friendly staff and wonderful service make these sites quite popular among tourists. You can also plan for static holidays if you do not wish to take the hassle of driving during a vacation. The place is well connected and you can easily reach it by train or road.Things you should look for while selecting a campsites Cambridgeshire are one, if it is safe and secure for the family or the group; two, the facilities available and services offered; three, flexibility to accommodate special requirements; four, activities to keep the young kids engaged; five, quality of food and beverages; six, quality of the pitch for caravanning Cambridge and finally rates offered. You should choose a place that score well in all these parameters. You will find some good camping sites on the banks of river Ouse that has facilities for boat tours, walking tours, angling and other sporting facilities like golf, swimming or recreation for the family. When you are caravanning Cambridge safety should be your first priority if you do not want to spoil your holiday in a nasty accident. If you are staying in a tent take care to avoid carbon monoxide poisoning. For example, barbecues can produce carbon monoxide even if they are working well. The symptoms of CO poisoning is sometime similar to flu or mild food poisoning. So, always look for campsites Cambridgeshire that are safe with arrangements for proper ventilation. Popular campsites Cambridgeshire take proper measures to ensure fire safety and precautions for gas and other fuel-related accidents. Electrical installations are checked periodically to see everything is running as per arrangements. Recreational facilities including boating etc. are supervised by experts who have proper training and there are experts to take care of sports-related injuries. When you are caravanning Cambridge check the physical condition of the pitch as well and if it is ready for parking your motor or caravan. Always carry basic first aid kit with you, because a trip over a guy line or tent peg is quite common or an injury when you try to fix the pegs with your feet.
